Name: Estuary Clue A
Subtitle: Clue
Card Text: 6*3*<<NL>>Random Argonaut gains 1 Despair token
Flavor: The directions were vague at best. This is the north coast, somewhere near Knossos

Name: Estuary Clue B
Subtitle: Clue
Card Text: 4*3*<<NL>>Random Argonaut gains 1 Despair token
Flavor: The directions were vague at best. They said it was close to Knossos, on the south coast

Name: Estuary Clue C
Subtitle: Clue
Card Text: 1*8*<<NL>>Random Argonaut gains 1 Despair token
Flavor: The directions were vague at best, but they mentioned it was quite far away, north-east of Knossos

Name: Estuary Clue D
Subtitle: Clue
Card Text: 2*2*<<NL>>Random Argonaut gains 1 Despair token
Flavor: The directions were vague at best. It's in the south-east of the island

Name: River Course
Subtitle: Pursuit
Card Text: Nothing Happens
Flavor: The river is eerily quiet. Something isn't right

Name: River Course
Subtitle: Pursuit
Card Text: Nothing Happens
Flavor: The river is eerily quiet. Something isn't right

Name: River Course
Subtitle: Pursuit
Card Text: Random Argonaut gains 1 Despair token
Flavor: The river is eerily quiet. Something isn't right

Name: Deadly Shallows
Subtitle: Pursuit
Card Text: Lose -1 @Hull
Flavor: Even with the upgraded tech Argo has trouble navigating this part of the river

Name: Maze Canal
Subtitle: Pursuit
Card Text: %ArgoFate 7+% Random Argonaut who is not Mazetouched gains the Mazetouched Affliction
Flavor: The river becomes a twisting, symmetrical canal

Name: Old Maze Canal
Subtitle: Pursuit
Card Text: %ArgoFate 6+% Random Argonaut gains 1 Despair token
Flavor: The river becomes a twisting, symmetrical canal

Name: Populated Maze Canal
Subtitle: Pursuit
Card Text: Gain +1 @Strangers
Flavor: The river becomes a twisting, symmetrical canal. Maze-marked people subsist on both banks

Name: Reshaped Canal
Subtitle: Pursuit
Card Text: Gain +1 @Doom
Flavor: The river becomes a twisting, symmetrical canal

Name: Reshaped Lake
Subtitle: Pursuit
Card Text: Gain +1 @Strangers
Flavor: A lake was made part of the maze canal system. Even the water starts to look... angular

Name: Symmachy Flagship
Subtitle: Pursuit
Card Text: You found the Flagship! See 0058
Flavor: The Symmachy Flagship glistens with light of a hundred torches

Name: Pristine Minotaur Statue
Subtitle: Clue
Card Text: No coordinates here! Random Argonaut gains 1 Despair token
Flavor: There must be a royalist village nearby

Name: Transformed Temple
Subtitle: Clue
Card Text: The Map Tile you are currently on designates the latitude coordinate of the Acropolis Sepulcher. Note this Tile's number in the Map section of the Argo Sheet. *Discarding*: If you are told to discard this card by the Story 3A effect, discard another card from the [Temple Deck]. Then return this card to the deck
Flavor: Someone reshaped the old statue into something otherworldly and sinister. There's a secret chamber here and in it, a partial map to the Sepulcher Acropolis

Name: Daedalus Safehouse
Subtitle: Clue
Card Text: The Map Tile you are currently on designates the latitude coordinate of the Acropolis Sepulcher. Note this Tile's number in the Map section of the Argo Sheet. *Discarding*: If you are told to discard this card by the Story 3A effect, discard another card from the [Temple Deck]. Then return this card to the deck
Flavor: There's a secret chamber here and in it, a partial map to your destination. What business did Daedalus have with the Sepulcher Acropolis

Name: Ruined Minotaur Statue
Subtitle: Clue
Card Text: No coordinates here! Gain +1 @Strangers
Flavor: The Hornsworn made short work of this statue

Name: Forgotten Minotaur Statue
Subtitle: Clue
Card Text: No coordinates here! Gain +1 @ArgoKnowledge
Flavor: This old status shows a young Minotaur. The artist rendered him as a beautiful, somewhat effeminate creature

Name: Minoan Guide
Subtitle: Ally
Card Text: Write 'Acacallis' in the _Boons, Afflictions, and Notes_ section of the Argo Sheet. Various effects may instruct you to make tally marks next to her name. If there are 10 or moretally marks besides Acacallis, see 0043. You may dismiss the Princess at the end of any Voyage Phase. If you do, see 0011
Flavor: Aloof and demanding, the Princess mostly keeps to her quarters

Name: Old Spinner
Subtitle: Ally
Card Text: You may dismiss the Old Spinner during the Story Step. If you do, discard this card
Flavor: The wizened woman keeps to herself. When she thinks nobody is looking, she fiddles with her fingers, as if she was rolling a ball of yarn

Name: Xenodice Map
Subtitle: Clue
Image Description: A map depicting the locations of the 5 _____, located on tiles ...
Flavor: Was it Daedalus's madness, or Xenodice's?

Name: Cyclopean Gate Ignition Key
Subtitle: Ignition Key
Card Text: 1*8*<<NL>>When you have this card, add +1 to all tests during the Adventure Phase on @Cyclopes tiles
Flavor: This sluice gate was built on the ruins of an old cataract outpost

Name: Eastern Gate Ignition Key
Subtitle: Ignition Key
Card Text: 2*6*<<NL>>When you have this card, add +1 to all tests during the Adventure Phase on @Symmachy tiles
Flavor: This sluice gate has sustained damage from repeated Symmachy attacks

Name: Leonidas Stoa Ignition Key
Subtitle: Ignition Key
Card Text: 6*3*<<NL>>When you have this card, add +1 to all [Hope Logic|AA0038] save tests
Flavor: Here lies buried Leonidas, one who could not kill the Nietzschean

Name: Black Gate Ignition Key
Subtitle: Ignition Key
Card Text: 4*3*<<NL>>When you have this card, add +1 to all tests during the Adventure Phase on @Helot tiles
Flavor: Blackened by regular ambrosia spillages, this gate is mostly used by traders and laborers

Name: First Cataract Fortification Line
Subtitle: Map
Flavor: The First Cataract. This is as far as your advanced scouts got

Name: Second Cataract Fortification Line
Flavor: You can only guess what dreadful landscape awaits you beyond the Second Cataract

Name: Fortresses Of Central Lakonia
Subtitle: Map
Flavor: Each one an Ares-class behemoth

Name: Outer Keep
Subtitle: Fortress
Flavor: This keep stands watch over the precarious plains of the Contested Lands

Name: Kyklopes Keep
Subtitle: Fortress
Flavor: Under this fortress, old Cyclopes' bones stir

Name: Central First Perimeter Fortress
Subtitle: Fortress
Flavor: The centerpiece of the First Cataract defense line

Name: Eastern First Perimeter Fortress
Subtitle: Fortress
Flavor: This citadel serves as a prison for Symmachy war criminals

Name: Central Second Perimeter Fortress
Subtitle: Fortress
Flavor: The centerpiece of the Second Cataract defense line

Name: Lakonias
Subtitle: Fortress
Flavor: This fortress was once a beautiful place of contemplation

Name: Fireships
Subtitle: Argophylae
Card Text: Lose -1 @Hull. Place an additional Blockade token on a space opposite the currently used Blockade token (ignore this effect if that's the only viable route). Discard it at the end of the next Movement Step
Flavor: You've seen this once before. A flaming fleet to boil the sea - and the Argo with it

Name: Boarding Bridges
Subtitle: Argophylae
Card Text: Lose -1 @Crew. Place an additional Blockade token on a space opposite the currently used Blockade token (ignore this effect if that's the only viable route). Discard it at the end of the next Movement Step
Flavor: Rotating cranes and Ambrosia Elephants powered by ungodly hydraulics are extended over the canal to allow boarding from above

Name: Machinations
Subtitle: Argophylae
Card Text: Gain +2 @Doom. Place an additional Blockade token on a space opposite the currently used Blockade token (ignore this effect if that's the only viable route). Discard it at the end of the next Movement Step
Flavor: While Argo fights for its life, the Nietzschean advances his master plan

Name: Cyclopean Snares
Subtitle: Argophylae
Card Text: Lose -2 Titans
Flavor: Giant-sized mechanical traps from a previous aeon, primed again for Titan hunting

Name: Ballista Fire
Subtitle: Argophylae
Card Text: Lose -1 @Hull or -1 @Crew
Flavor: Day and night, the fire does not cease

Name: Javelin Gauntlet
Subtitle: Argophylae
Card Text: Randomly choose one of your Argo Ability technologies. It is disabled and cannot be used! Write its name as an event on the Timeline, 10 days from now. When you resolve this event, it is repaired and ready to use
Flavor: Through a city canal, where the javelins darken the skies

Name: Hammer & Anvil
Subtitle: Argophylae
Card Text: At the end of the current Step, resolve a regular Cyclonus Battle but *do not* mark it on the Evolution Track. The Cyclonus' level is determined by the last marked box on its Evolution Track. After the Battle, return this card to the box (do not shuffle it into the Argophylae deck when it runs out of cards)
Flavor: Coralled into a tight canal, with the might of the Nietzschean fleet behind you, you face a Cyclonus enforcer

Name: Apella Delegate
Subtitle: Identity
Card Text: *Administrative Clearance*. Add the [Gerusia Delegate|BC1193] Clue card to the Identity deck
Flavor: A Spartiates representitive who survived the Cleansing

Name: Gerusia Delegate
Subtitle: Identity
Card Text: *Administrative Clearance*. Add the [Gerusia Delegate|BC1193] Clue card to the Identity dec.
Flavor: To be old and alive in the New World Order, you need to be a god or a monster

Name: Krypteia Agent
Subtitle: Identity
Card Text: *Security Clearance*. Add the [Krypteia Spymaster|BC1195] Clue card to the Identity deck
Flavor: You see the Krypteia only when it wants to be seen. And then it is too late

Name: Krypteia Spymaster
Subtitle: Identity
Card Text: *Security Clearance*. When you have this card, the first @City Negotation ability you use during the day costs you -1 @ArgoFate less (to a minimum of 0)
Flavor: Even the Ephors fear the ever vigilant eye of the Krypteia

Name: Hippeis Commander
Subtitle: Identity
Card Text: *Military Clearance*. Add the [Hermes Hoplites Commander|BC1197] Clue card to the Identity deck
Flavor: A Spartiates warrior leading one of the cohorts

Name: Hermes Hoplites Commander
Subtitle: Identity
Card Text: *Military Clearance*. When you have this card, each time you use the Expedition ability from the [Titan Hunting|AA0044] Technology card, add +1 to the result
Flavor: A Superior Spartiates ordering a force that can bring down a Titan

Name: Ambrosia Extraction Advisor
Subtitle: Identity
Card Text: *Black Industries Clearance*. Add the [Ambrosia Processing Overseer|BC1199] Clue card to the Identity deck
Flavor: An astrologer and alchemist, leader of an Ambrosia Extraction Platform

Name: Ambrosia Processing Overseer
Subtitle: Identity
Card Text: *Black Industries Clearance*. When you have this card, if a Sabotage effect requires you to note an event on the Timeline, note it 5 days from your current day instead
Flavor: A tinker and philosopher supervising the refinement of raw ambrosia

Name: Agiad King
Subtitle: Identity
Card Text: *Inner Circle Clearance*. Add the [Ephor|BC1202] Clue card to the Identity deck (if available)
Flavor: The position of the Agaid King brings the Nietzschean's regime much needed legitimacy

Name: Eurypontid King
Subtitle: Identity
Card Text: *Inner Circle Clearance*. Add the [Ephor|BC1202] Clue card to the Identity deck (if available)
Flavor: In Nietzschean's Sparta, even a King is a lapdog

Name: Ephor
Subtitle: Identity
Card Text: *Inner Circle Clearance*. When you have this card, add +1 to all save tests that allow you to mitigate @Hull loss. Add the [High Preist of Man|BC1203] Clue card to the Identity deck
Flavor: Ephors are the de facto governors and generals of Sparta

Name: High Priest Of Man
Subtitle: Identity
Card Text: *Inner Circle Clearance*. When you have this card, add +1 to all save tests that allow you to mitigate @Doom gain
Flavor: The one who did not hesitate

Name: Bloodied Wreaths
Subtitle: Title
Card Text: When in Sparta, gain +1 to save tests that allow you to mitigate either @Crew or @Hull loss
Flavor: You have looked into the Abyss and made it blink

Name: The Wolf Among Us
Subtitle: Loyalty
Card Text: The Krypteia assassins have infiltrated your ranks. *You are not one of them*, but the evidence suggests there is a spy among you, posing as an Argonaut. Their instructions are printed on the Loyalty card they were dealt. Observe your fellow players carefully, looking for any signs of treachery. At a later point you will be asked to vote which of you is an imposter

Name: The Wolf Among Us
Subtitle: Loyalty
Card Text: The Krypteia assassins have infiltrated your ranks. *You are not the traitor*, but the evidence suggests there is a spy among you, posing as an Argonaut. Their instructions are printed on the Loyalty card they were dealt. Observe your fellow players carefully, looking for any signs of treachery. At a later point you will be asked to vote which of you is an imposter

Name: The Wolf Among Us
Subtitle: Loyalty
Card Text: The Krypteia assassins have infiltrated your ranks. *You are loyal to the Argo*, but the evidence suggests there is a spy among you, posing as an Argonaut. Their instructions are printed on the Loyalty card they were dealt. Observe your fellow players carefully, looking for any signs of treachery. At a later point you will be asked to vote which of you is an imposter

Name: The Wolf Among Us
Subtitle: Loyalty
Card Text: The Krypteia assassins have infiltrated your ranks. *You did not betray your comrades*, but the evidence suggests there is a spy among you, posing as an Argonaut. Their instructions are printed on the Loyalty card they were dealt. Observe your fellow players carefully, looking for any signs of treachery. At a later point you will be asked to vote which of you is an imposter

Name: Map Of The Past
Subtitle: Map
Flavor: This is the reconstructed map of Delphi from the time before the Eschaton

Name: Finish The Prime Lighthouse
Subtitle: Event
Card Text: When you are on tile 32, during the Story Step, lose -1 @Hull to repair the Prime Lighthouse ahead of schedule. Mark J9
Flavor: Icarus used his father's lighthouses to guide his ship to the skies, but one failed to activate. Perhaps some of the rare components and alloys of the Argo's hull could repair it before the ill-fated flight..

Name: Design A Mazestone Solution
Subtitle: Event
Card Text: When you are on tile 46, during the Story Step, gain +1 @Doom to alter the Sirenshell Crucible. Mark J3
Flavor: Icarus's vessel uses a Sirenshell core to contain the paracausal energies of its central machina, but there was a problem with its configuration. Maybe it would be better to use Mazeflesh in its construction..

Name: Infiltrate The Expedition
Subtitle: Event
Card Text: When you are on tile 42, during the Story Step, lose -1 @Crew to replace the Oracle who accompanies the mission. Mark F6
Flavor: Icarus needed a Delphian Oracle to plot the Aspirant's course, but the one he chose lacked confidence in his abilities. Maybe another candidate from among the Argo's crew will not hesitate

Name: Broker A Deal
Subtitle: Event
Card Text: When you are on tile 37, during the Story Step, gain +2 @Paradox to convince Icarus to accept outside help. Mark N4
Flavor: While preparing for the Aspirant's mission, Icarus was approached by Symmachy agents with offers of aid and resources. He refused, but perhaps you can convince him to accept instead..

Name: Provide A Titan
Subtitle: Event
Card Text: When you are on tile 48, during the Story Step, lose -1 Titan to provide the Aspirant with a tamed Titan. Mark M7
Flavor: Some of the Aspirant's larger machina need a colossus to operate them. Icarus used a Gaia-born Titan he captured and tamed himself, but perhaps one of your Titans might be better suited to the task..

Name: Donate Refined Ambrosia
Subtitle: Event
Card Text: When you are on tile 54, during the Story Step, lose any 10 Primordial resources to reveal the impurities in the ambrosia stockpile. Mark B4
Flavor: The Aspirant's mission required prodigious amounts of ambrosia to fuel it, but the supplies received contained impurities. The Argo's ambrosia stockpile, however, is of much higher quality, thanks to their recent visit to Sparta..

Name: Chariot 1A
Subtitle: Map
Image Description: Picture of four tiles, one with a chariot piece on it
Flavor: This map shows the possible location of a Sunheir chariot part

Name: Chariot 2B
Subtitle: Map
Image Description: Picture of four tiles, one with a chariot piece on it
Flavor: This map shows the possible location of a stolen Exile chariot part

Name: Chariot 1B
Subtitle: Map
Image Description: Picture of four tiles, one with a chariot piece on it
Flavor: This map shows the possible location of a stolen Exile chariot part

Name: Chariot 2A
Subtitle: Map
Image Description: Picture of four tiles, one with a chariot piece on it
Flavor: This map shows the possible location of a Sunheir chariot part

Name: Irembihazar
Subtitle: Search
Card Text: See 0047
Flavor: Oh, Irembihazar, the jewel of the Empire, my gilded love!

Name: City of Beggars
Subtitle: Search
Card Text: See 0049
Flavor: The Empire is so wealthy that only the most lazy and stupid are destitute

Name: The Great Bazaar
Subtitle: Search
Card Text: See 0051
Flavor: In the Great Bazaar of the Empire, everything is for sale, and for a fair price too!

Name: Bankrupt Metropolis
Subtitle: Search
Card Text: See 0053
Flavor: If you fail in the name of the Empire, the Empire will bail you out

Name: Aristotelian Conquered City
Subtitle: Search
Card Text: See 0055
Flavor: Equality for all--is that not the very essence of commerce?

Name: Post-Collapse Palace City
Subtitle: Search
Card Text: See 0057
Flavor: Even in ruin are our cities the envy of all onlookers

Name: Pandora's Tower Looms
Subtitle: Cloud Chase
Card Text: *If this is the 5th+ Cloud Chase card:* Repeat this card once, if possible.<<NL>> If this is the last card played, you've found the Hanging Gardens! See 0094. Gain +1 @Doom

Name: Lookout Irem Tower
Subtitle: Cloud Chase
Card Text: *If this is the 6th+ Cloud Chase card:* Repeat this card once, if possible.<<NL>> If this is the last card played, you've found the Hanging Gardens! See 0094. Gain +1 @Progress

Name: Violent Wish Storm
Subtitle: Cloud Chase
Card Text: *If this is the 7th+ Cloud Chase card:* Repeat this card once, if possible.<<NL>> If this is the last card played, you've found the Hanging Gardens! See 0094. Loses -1 @Hull

Name: Lure of an Opulent Oasis
Subtitle: Cloud Chase
Card Text: *If this is the 8th+ Cloud Chase card:* Repeat this card, if possible, then, if possible, repeat it again.<<NL>> If this is the last card played, you've found the Hanging Gardens! See 0094. Lose -1 @Crew

Name: Waster Shantytown
Subtitle: Cloud Chase
Card Text: *If this is the 9th+ Cloud Chase card:* Repeat this card, if possible, then, if possible, repeat it again.<<NL>> If this is the last card played, you've found the Hanging Gardens! See 0094. Gain +1 @Crew

Name: Cloud Thieves Shipyard
Subtitle: Cloud Chase
Card Text: *If this is the last Cloud Chase card:* Repeat this card, if possible, then, if possible, repeat it again, then, if possible, repeat it for a third and final time.<<NL>> If this is the last card played, you've found the Hanging Gardens! See 0094. Gain +1 @Hull

Name: Downed Debt Ark
Subtitle: Cloud Chase
Card Text: *If this Cloud Chase card would go over a tile with a Cloud Chase card:* Repeat this card once, if possible.<<NL>> If this is the last card played, you've found the Hanging Gardens! See 0094. Lose -1 @BabelianDebt

Name: Skygazing Titan
Subtitle: Cloud Chase
Card Text: *If this Cloud Chase card would go over a tile with a Cloud Chase card:* Repeat this card, if possible, then, if possible, repeat it again.<<NL>> If this is the last card played, you've found the Hanging Gardens! See 0094. Gain +1 @Titan

Name: Shadow of a Debt Ark
Subtitle: Cloud Chase
Card Text: *If this Cloud Chase card would go over a tile with a Cloud Chase card:* Repeat this card, if possible, then, if possible, repeat it again.<<NL>> If this is the last card played, you've found the Hanging Gardens! See 0094. Gain +1 @BabelianDebt

Name: Meteorological Tower
Subtitle: Cloud Chase
Card Text: *If this Cloud Chase card would go over a tile with a Cloud Chase card:* Repeat this card, if possible, then, if possible, repeat it again, then, if possible, repeat it for a third and final time.<<NL>> If this is the last card played, you've found the Hanging Gardens! See 0094. Gain +1 @ArgoKnowledge

Name: Scheherazade
Subtitle: Ally
Card Text: At the start of Story 2A, without looking, discard 1 card from the City of Splendor deck. You may dismiss Scheherazade at the end of any Voyage Phase. If you do, see 0095

Name: Law of Bargains
Subtitle: Cipher
Card Text: The God-King granted his people the Law of Bargains, so the senseless bloodshed over petty squabbles could end, for he saw them as more than --Babelian Text--yphon.<<NL>><<NL>>--Babelian Text--

Name: The Royal Game
Subtitle: Cipher
Card Text: Many games are played across Immortal --Babelian Text--ersia, for its citizens enjoy personal growth and free time, luxuries not afforded previously, under the rule of the gods.<<NL>><<NL>>--Babelian Text--

Name: Wish-Veil
Subtitle: Cipher
Card Text: So great was the wealth he had accumulated that it became like a second sun, blinding to all but the most wealthy citizens, like --Babelian Text--roesus or Midas. Thus it was hidden by a powerful veil woven of wishes.<<NL>><<NL>>--Babelian Text--

Name: Hanging Gardens
Subtitle: Cipher
Card Text: They are not one of, but the wonder of the World, a symbol of the wealth and power generated by the --Babelian Text--nfinite Growth of Persia's system, and a promise that each and every one of its citizens can either aspire to one day walk its fabulous halls, or simply wait for its opulence to trickle down<<NL>><<NL>>--Babelian Text--

Name: Pandora's Jar
Subtitle: Cipher
Card Text: The Empire is as the --Babelian Text--un above, brilliant and eternal, and its Great Tower will take us to the stars, so the Infinite Growth can continue to the vacant heavenly realms.<<NL>><<NL>>--Babelian Text--

Name: The Mural
Subtitle: Cipher
Card Text: --Babelian Text--

Name: Stolen Clouds
Subtitle: Message
Card Text: At any time you may cross out 1 Stolen Clouds tally mark to lose -1 @ArgoFate
Flavor: The truth of the stolen clouds. Will you help spread the word?

Name: Unbestowed
Subtitle: Message
Card Text: At any time you may cross out 1 Unbestowed tally mark to lose -1 @BabelianDebt
Flavor: What was uprooted needs to be replanted

Name: Day After Tomorrow
Subtitle: Message
Card Text: *Cursed Trait*. Add this Trait to every Cycle IV Battle. When you gain more than 1 Midas token, give 1 of those tokens to another random Titan
Flavor: The Aristotelian command has declared victory, yet many continue to fight

Name: Rule One
Subtitle: Infinite Climb
Card Text: If the numbers match, you move the Titan and the Entrance the indicated number of spaces and leave these cards face-up (first the Entrance, then the Titan!). Then, move the Entrance one additional spaces. Finally, remove any Midas tokens from these cards and move the Titan again for each one you removed

Name: Rule Two
Subtitle: Infinite Climb
Card Text: If the numbers don't match and both are odd, move the Entrance by the higher value and place a Midas token on that card

Name: Rule Three
Subtitle: Infinite Climb
Card Text: If the numbers don't match and both are even, move the Entrance by the lower value and place a Midas token on that card

Name: Rule Four
Subtitle: Infinite Climb
Card Text: If the numbers don't match and one is odd and the other is even, neither the Titan nor the Entrance move

Name: Rule Five
Subtitle: Infinite Climb
Card Text: Sadly, as the Empire chases Infinite Growth, time grows shorter: *Immediately lose 1 Grip and 1 round*. Do this only once

Name: Unreliable Intel V
Subtitle: Atlantean Coordinates
Card Text: White Haven is located at IV (062) or VI (059). If you start the Story Step on one of these underwater @City, see 1037
Flavor: The locations of Atlantean cities are a closely guarded secret. The clues you are given refer to the Great Atlantean Spiral

Subtitle: Atlantean Coordinates
Card Text: White Haven is located at V (076) or III (021). If you start the Story Step on one of these underwater @City, see 1037
Flavor: The locations of Atlantean cities are a closely guarded secret. The clues you are given refer to the Great Atlantean Spiral

Name: Liaison
Subtitle: Ally
Card Text: Write "Liaison" in the Boons, Afflictions, and Notes section of the Argo Sheet.<<NL>><<NL>>You may dismiss the Liaison at the end of any Voyage Phase. You must dismiss them if you removed your last Liaison tally mark. In both cases, see 0101
Flavor: Cold and aloof

Name: Atlantean Capital Cycle A
Subtitle: Phos Map
Card Text: 6*3*<<NL>>If there are 5 or more @Progress on your current Story card, you may discard 5 Progress to see paragraph 0601 for an exact location
Flavor: The capital's location was kept hidden even from its own citizens--yet even this precation did not stave off the fall

Name: Eclipse Tablet
Subtitle: Eldritch Lore
Card Text: --Siren Script--
Flavor: The refuge has been hidden from this world, and thus can manifest itself in several places
